features: High resolution 1080P Full HD Webcam. Plug and play Batteries are not included. This 1080P webcam supply Crisp Image and Crystal Clear Video. Webcam captures your clips in true 1080p glory, and 30 frames per second, so even the most detailed makeup tutorials look crisp and clear.

Suitable for mainstream software, Compatible with multi system. Versatile 1080P USB webcam for gaming, blogging, conferencing and Live streaming, widely works with Windows 10, Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 2000, Windows XP, Android TV, Mac OS X etc. Compatible with Facebook, Skype, OBS, You Tube, Twitter，Twitch .

110 Degree Wide Angle Webcam with Microphone. Fixed focus Webcam captures Full HD video at a wide angle of up to 110 degrees. Giving you an unparalleled perspective for a wide variety of conditions when you live streaming, video chatting or recording. Build-in auto noise reduction Mic makes sound purer and clearer, and pick up your voice even at 3m distance. Also Easy to turn off the webcam microphone on the software setting you used, when you want to use your own headset or speake..

Easy to Setup, Play and Plug：The product has no battery.1080P webcam camera with low light correction, makes you see clearly even in dim light. Easy to Setup, just Play and Plug, No additional driver need. It also features a universal clip, with a 6ft USB power cable that fits to laptops and LCD monitors.

Webcam With Tripod and Privacy Cover. PC webcam with Privacy cover allows you to enjoy safe digital web life when not in use and prevent hackers from spying on you. To control what your video displays at any time, effectively protecting your privacy. The webcam comes with a tripod, convenient for you to place the computer camera..

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use
reviews.reviewText: Love that this is just plug in and it works. Quality is great. I have 2 now, one at work and one at home. So glad I found this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Simple, cheap, great picture.
reviews.reviewText: I have had a Logitech 720p camera for many years and it's never been all that sharp, and it hunts for and fails to get focus pretty often. Last week a friend was on a zoom call and I mentioned that her picture was amazingly good, she sent me a link to this camera. I bought it, plugged it in and now my picture is great too. Plugged in and worked instantly with no fuss on Zoom running under Linux Mint.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very good for video calls
reviews.reviewText: I got this a while back and have been very happy with it. I appreciate the mounting options it has and was able to get it set up with ease. The picture isn't the highest quality, but for a basic camera, it works very well. The quality is what I was expecting. The microphone might not be the best, but I usually use headphones with a mic, so that hasn't been an issue. It could also have been a slight distance issue.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Product - super cute!
reviews.reviewText: The whole office enjoyed these cameras - sit easily on the monitors and the option to have it on a stand somewhere inconspicuous is great!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Picture is okay, mic terrible
reviews.reviewText: I’ve had this for a few months now. I work from home and my previous cam died. The picture quality is okay, but the mic is not very good. It’s very quiet and sounds like you’re talking from across the room even though it’s less than 2 feet away.I’ve tried Windows 11 sound settings (I work in IT for a BIg10 university) and even putting a cardboard baffle around the sides and back of the camera to direct sound in. No luck.When writing this review, there’s no option to rate the quality of the audio, only the picture. It’s like they knew it was bad and purposely removed the ability to grade it. That should tell you something.I end up using my headset mic instead, which is unfortunate because I was hoping to simply use the webcam and the built-in mic for meetings. I’ll have to get a better quality device if I want to do that.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good but doesn't work with Teams
reviews.reviewText: This is a good little webcam. It worked great when my company used Google Meet or Zoom, but doesn't work with Microsoft Teams no matter how hard I've tried to troubleshoot it. It just makes the picture look messed up and frozen.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great and good price
reviews.reviewText: Works fine, good 1080p camera for budget minded folk.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Works on a Chromebook, but the lighting is HORRIBLE and it has another MAJOR problem.
reviews.reviewText: Well, this camera isn't entirely bad (I'm giving it a 2 out of 5 star rating. It's not horrible enough to receive a one star and it's not abysmal enough to have me ranting and raving that it's a zero, but it's not that good either and it's only getting a 2 out of 5 from me).I plugged it into two Chromebooks (I also own a very high-spec gaming laptop but that thing already has a great high quality cam attached to it, so this camera was meant for my Chromebooks which have very grainy, low quality cams) . One of those Chromebooks is a first generation Acer Chromebook (one of the oldest Chromebooks that came out SEVERAL years ago). Good news is that it WORKS with all the Chromebooks, even the oldest Acer Chromebook I have (to activate this cam, plug in the USB, go to your normal webcam on your Chromebook and turn that on, then at your normal Chromebook webcam you will see a circle in the lower left hand corner (might be in a different location for you). Click on that and it activates and switches to your new external webcam. Pretty cool... except for a few VERY significant problems:1) The lighting is HORRIBLE on this external webcam!!!! Yes, the overall picture quality is much better (well, at least the parts you can actually see) but the lighting is ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE in comparison to the severely much brighter cam that's already built into the Chromebook (even my oldest Acer Chromebook's built in cam that is almost nine years old has far superior lighting). You will need to supply EXTRA light in your room for this external webcam to match the lighting supplied by your old Chromebook camera. Without supplying extra light you are left with A LOT of darkness to the point where you can barely see your own face a few inches away from the external webcam.2) When you do supply extra lighting (and you are going to need a significant amount of extra lighting. Your windows open during the day WITH extra lamps), while the camera quality looks nice at first (it is better than the Chromebook's own cam since it's not as grainy, ignoring the far superior lighting the Chromebook's built in cam already has) if you try to have the camera focus on something that requires high definition (like words on a piece of paper) you will notice that it will NOT be clear and will be blurry / out of focus in most cases (which strongly puts into question whether or not this cam is truly 1080 p).Due to these two major flaws, I have to give this cam a 2 out of 5.IF you can get extra lighting (whether through putting several extra lamps in your room OR if using a PC you can use a program of some sort that somehow increases the lighting) and you only plan on using this cam for general use (EX: you do NOT plan on focusing on anything like words on a page because if you do it's going to be out of focus and hard to read for whoever is viewing your cam) then it's okay.But if you have the extra money, definitely pay up the extra money and get a better cam that's truly high definition.This cam is cheap and is currently only about $20 for a reason.Save up money and get a better cam, even if it costs you more.You get what you pay for.As a result, I give this webcam a 2 out of 5.

I found this to be a good little camera for the price. The picture comes out very nice and you can record video, still pictures or scan bar codes.The range of vision is excellent. It installs with no problems and comes with a privacy shutter. Can't go wrong at this price.

Got this for $20 on Amazon - yes $20... amazed at the value for money the quality of the camera is great, some feedback:1/ It's a wide angle (ie fish bowl style) picture looks great, just it gets more of the whole room in so be aware of that vs the flat mac camera2/ the quality is crisp and clear3/ it's easy to setup, the USB slot needs to be powered so I couldn't use the USB bank i had, i had to plug it directly into the macbook4/ the lights at the top no way to turn them off so it's a bit annoying with a strong red and green light there.5/ the latch you attach and it sticks up when opened which is a bit annoying6/ the stand is good and solid.Overall, a 4/5, but for $20, it's a 5/5, can't beat the price vs quality. It serves the purpose, definitely would not fork out the crazy prices for the logitech cameras out there, this is perfect for the intended purpose.Also i was concerned with it intruding onto my monitor, but it's perfect and works well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good webcam but looks kind of cheap.
reviews.reviewText: I like this camera and it mounts very easily on top of both my monitors and is very easy to adjust the position and move around. As far as the actual camera quality goes, the picture is fairly clear but there’s definitely a lot of ‘noise’. There is also a weird colour effect and i cant seem to find anyway to turn it off or adjust it. My friend and I both got this camera to video call when we play games but we have both noticed the noise and colour effect on our own pictures and each others pictures.Overall, its still a good camera for the price and i didn’t feel the need to return it, but if you’re someone looking for something more high quality maybe for streaming or content creation i would suggest looking for something different, but if you’re like me this camera is good for video calling with friends/colleagues/school etc.

Can't comment on the mic because I can't use it. However the video is exceptional at the price point. Very clean and clear. Very happy over all. The pictures make it look like the base is either heavy enough, or the hinge is stiff enough to lock the camera in place on the top of the monitor. It's not. It can't be used as an anchor as the pictures suggest (though admittedly that isn't specifically stated anywhere). But it's well balanced enough that a bit of double-sided tape is all it needs to remain solid. Simple set up. I didn't actually have to do anything other than plug it in. Windows 10 did the rest. Works like any other inbuilt would. The lens cover is a handy addition to avert any paranoia about someone taking over your camera and trying to blackmail you in a poorly written bulk English translation mailout.
Plug and play, sits on its little tripod legs, mic and camera work great. Lens cover is nice feature.
